Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a land habitat, such as a playground, garden, or forest.
The student can draw a water habitat, such as a pond, stream, or lake.
The student can illustrate different types of plants in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, or flowering plants.
The student can illustrate different types of animals in each habitat, such as lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, or clams.
The student can compare the different living things found in the two habitats by showing patterns in plant and animal diversity.
The student can organize the drawings to clearly show the plants and animals in each specific habitat.
